Comments_List: I learned about how ecological testing and monitoring work, and about salt marshes.

Problem solving 
Data collecting 
Team work
Laboratory experience
I reinforced field skills like sampling along a transect, taking soil samples, sampling vegetation, etc. I gained new skills the lab and with data analysis.
The knowledge and skills gained in the lab aligned well with my expectations and were worthwhile experiences.
Strength: the semester-long project in a lab group is a great model for this lab course.

Dan Kane was an awesome TA - so helpful in guiding us while allowing us to make our own choices (and mistakes). Timing could have been improved a little, as we ended up having a lot more work to do than we could hope to complete during class.

Overall, I can't think of many weaknesses of the lab section. The PhD students were fantastic and really helpful, the field work was great, and my survived the lab work despite perhaps biting off more than we could chew. I liked that we were introduced to so many tools for field work, lab work, remote sensing and GIS, and presenting. The lab and the course could have been more closely tied together, for they often seemed disconnected and unrelated in subject matter until the very end of the semester when our final paper sort of could tie them together.
If possible, just take the lab. It's worthwhile if you want to get some basic ecology field experience. The accompanying course, however, is a waste of time.
Make sure you understand the process of budgeting elements in your chosen environment.
I would encourage them to take the laboratory to get field experience which helps to further understand the theory part of the study
